content:
That's a great idea! Bringing the sweater with you to the mall will definitely help the tailor give you a more accurate estimate of the repair cost and time required. And kudos to you for donating your gently used clothes to Goodwill! It's always great to declutter and give back to the community.

Remember to also ask the tailor about their experience with similar repairs, their turn-around time, and their prices. You want to make sure you're leaving your favorite sweater in good hands.

And while you're at Goodwill, you might want to check out their selection of second-hand clothing. You never know what hidden gems you might find! Plus, it's a great way to reduce waste and support sustainable fashion.

Have a fantastic time at the mall, and I hope you get your sweater fixed and find some great deals on new socks and maybe even some second-hand treasures!
